title: Warm, premium artisan landing page for Indian handmade handicrafts gifting brand

requirements.text: Create a single-page, high-converting marketing landing page for an Indian handmade handicrafts gifting brand that offers curated and customized gift hampers, using a warm, premium, artisan-focused visual design and consistent styling across all sections.

quotes: Design a high-converting landing page for an Indian handmade handicrafts gifting brand offering curated and customized gift hampers, with a warm, premium, artisan-focused design.

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page is implemented as a single, scrollable page with clearly separated sections and consistent spacing/typography/colors.
Visual theme reads as warm + premium + artisan (e.g., earthy palette, textured accents, refined typography), without using a blue/purple primary palette.
Page is fully responsive (mobile/tablet/desktop) and maintains readable contrast and accessible font sizing.

requirements.text: Implement a conversion-focused hero section with: brand headline/subheadline in English, primary CTA (e.g., “Build My Gift Hamper”), secondary CTA (e.g., “Explore Curated Hampers”), trust signals (e.g., handmade, ethically sourced, pan-India delivery—wording in English), and a premium hero visual.

quotes: Design a high-converting landing page... offering curated and customized gift hampers

acceptanceCriteria: Hero contains 2 CTAs with distinct visual hierarchy (primary vs secondary).
Hero includes at least 3 trust signals displayed as badges/chips with icons.
CTA buttons scroll to the relevant sections (customization form / curated hampers section).

requirements.text: Add key landing page sections tailored to curated/customized gift hampers: (1) Curated Hampers showcase (3–6 cards), (2) “Customize Your Hamper” step-by-step explainer, (3) Artisan story/values section highlighting handmade craftsmanship, (4) Social proof (testimonials/ratings), (5) FAQ, and (6) final CTA banner.
acceptanceCriteria: Each section has a clear heading, supporting copy in English, and a consistent component style (cards, chips, separators).
Curated Hampers section shows at least 3 hamper examples with name, short description, and ‘Request This Hamper’ CTA.
FAQ is interactive (accordion-style) and includes at least 5 questions relevant to customization, lead time, shipping, and bulk/corporate gifting.
Final CTA section reiterates primary conversion action and links to the form.

requirements.text: Implement a lead-capture form for customized hampers that collects: name, email, phone (optional but recommended), occasion type, budget range, preferred items/themes (free text), quantity, delivery city/pincode (text), and an optional notes field; include client-side validation and a success state.
acceptanceCriteria: Form validates required fields (name, email, occasion, budget, quantity) and shows inline error messages.
On submit, form calls the backend and shows a non-blocking loading state; on success it resets (or preserves) fields and displays a confirmation message.
No third-party email/SMS integrations are used.

requirements.text: Add a minimal Motoko backend endpoint to store lead submissions (custom hamper inquiries) and return a confirmation response; persist submissions in stable storage so they survive canister upgrades.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes an update method to create an inquiry and returns an ID and timestamp (or equivalent confirmation fields).
Inquiries are stored persistently (stable-compatible data structure) and are retrievable via a query method (for verification/testing).
Backend remains a single-actor architecture in the main Motoko actor file; add a migration file only if the generated template already includes state that must be upgraded.

requirements.text: Add basic analytics-friendly structure without external services: semantic headings, consistent section IDs for CTA scrolling, and event hooks in code (e.g., function calls/logs) for key actions (primary CTA click, form submit success).
acceptanceCriteria: Each major section has a stable DOM id (e.g., #curated, #customize, #testimonials, #faq).
Primary CTA scroll behavior uses these IDs and works on mobile and desktop.
Key actions are centralized in code (single handler functions) so adding real analytics later is straightforward, without integrating any external analytics SDK now.

requirements.text: Ensure the landing page meets baseline UX quality: fast initial render, optimized images, accessible interactions (keyboard-friendly accordions and focus states), and polished microcopy suitable for a premium gifting brand (English only).
acceptanceCriteria: All interactive elements are keyboard accessible and show visible focus styles.
Images are served as static assets and sized appropriately to avoid layout shift.
Copy is coherent, premium in tone, and consistent (no placeholder lorem ipsum).

requirements.text: Create and apply a coherent visual theme (colors, typography, spacing, and component styling) that evokes warm, premium, artisan craftsmanship, and enforce it consistently across the page.
acceptanceCriteria: Theme includes a defined primary/secondary color set, background treatment, and typography pairing used across hero, cards, buttons, and FAQ.
Buttons, cards, and badges share a consistent design system (radii, shadows, borders).
Theme avoids a default ‘generic SaaS’ look and does not rely on a blue/purple primary palette.

requirements.text: Add a lightweight footer with brand reassurance and conversion-supporting links: Contact (mailto/phone text only), Shipping/Returns (static text section or modal), and a short brand note about handmade/craftsmanship.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer includes at least one contact method presented as text and/or clickable links (mailto: / tel:).
Shipping/Returns information is present and readable without navigating away (either inline section or dialog).

constraints: Use React + TypeScript + Tailwind + shadcn/ui composition patterns (do not edit immutable UI component source files).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor; do not introduce additional backend services or external databases.
Do not integrate third-party auth providers; Internet Identity is the only supported auth (not required for this landing page).
Use English for all user-facing text.
nonGoals: E-commerce checkout, payments, or shopping cart.
Third-party marketing integrations (Google Analytics, Meta Pixel, email marketing tools).
Complex admin dashboard for managing inquiries (beyond a basic retrieval method for verification/testing).
